definition: suona, Chinese shawm (oboe), used in festivals and processions or for military purposes/also written 鎖吶|锁呐/also called 喇叭[la3 ba5]
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])

sentences.english: Suona another is the main, together with a group of percussion instruments.
sentences.chinese: 另一种是以唢呐为主，加上一组打击乐器。

sentences.english: Daming is playing the suona, but the phone rings.
sentences.chinese: 大明正在吹唢呐，但是电话响了。

sentences.english: The folk custom activities have cultivated all outstanding Suona entertainers of Bai Minority.
sentences.chinese: 民俗活动培育了历代优秀的白族唢呐艺人。

sentences.english: He is playing the suona, but the telephone rings.
sentences.chinese: 他正在吹唢呐，但是电话响了。

definition: suona, Chinese shawm/see 嗩吶|唢呐
a bowed stringed instrument with a thin wooden soundboard
jinghu, a smaller, higher-pitched erhu 二胡 (two-stringed fiddle) used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京二胡
huqin/family of Chinese two-stringed fiddles, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and bamboo bow with horsehair bowstring
sanxian, large family of 3-stringed plucked musical instruments, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and long neck, used in folk music, opera and Chinese orchestra
same as 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]
sihu (or "khuurchir" in Mongolian), a bowed instrument with four strings, primarily associated with Mongolian and Chinese culture
